name: Cream Finance
excerpt: Inspector rekt back once again. $18.8M lost to a ghostface killer, this time from an old school DeFi protocol.

name: X-Token
excerpt: X-token X2 - The X-ploiter Returns. $4.5 million taken from their xSNX contract. A sequel normally leads to a series. Will the X-ploiters try for a trilogy?

name: Punk Protocol
excerpt: Punk is dead. On Aug 10th, Punk Protocol was hacked for $8.95M, ~$5M of which was later returned.

name: Poly Network
excerpt: This is it rekt readers; the big one. $611M stolen from Poly Network, but has the hacker had a change of heart? They're returning the money bit by bit.

name: Levyathan
excerpt: Levyathan Finance sank last week, along with its TVL of $1.5M. Basic errors lead to total destruction. Bad intentions or just raw incompetence? You decide.

name: Popsicle Finance
excerpt: Protocol meltdown. ~$20 million gone. A complex hack of a simple bug leaves Popsicle Finance in a sticky situation.

name: THORChain
excerpt: THORChain took a hammering. Recently the protocol was hit for $5M. A second strike saw them lose another $8M. What's next for THOR and their fanatical followers?

name: PancakeBunny
excerpt: Two months ago PancakeBunny got rekt on BSC, now the same thing has happened on Polygon. $2.4 million lost. How earitating.

name: THORChain
excerpt: Even the old gods cannot escape the exploits. As the cross-chain attacks continue, THORChain becomes the latest victim. $5 million lost.

name: Bondly
excerpt: In which Bondly battles the infinite mint. BONDLY token holders are now at a loss, due to an infinite mint exploit in which the attacker made a profit of $5.9 million.

name: Anyswap
excerpt: The bridges are burning. Anyswap and Chainswap in 24 hours. They say it's fixed, but can you trust them?

name: ChainSwap
excerpt: As the demand for DeFi increases across chains, the bridges that join them turn into targets themselves. A chain is only as strong as its weakest linkâ¦ Who will break next?

name: Merlin Labs
excerpt: The third timeâs a charm for Merlin Finance. Why do people keep going back?
